skill.name: pattern-detector
skill.description: Detect design patterns and anti-patterns in code with recommendations.
skill.summary: Detect design patterns and anti-patterns in code with recommendations.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution. Completely safe for installation.

content.value_statement: Poor code structure leads to technical debt and maintenance problems. This skill analyzes code to identify design patterns in use and anti-patterns that should be fixed, providing clear recommendations for improvement.
actual_capabilities: Identifies creational patterns like Singleton, Factory, Builder, and Prototype
Detects structural patterns including Adapter, Decorator, Facade, and Proxy
Recognizes behavioral patterns such as Observer, Strategy, Command, and State
Flags anti-patterns like God Object, Spaghetti Code, and Magic Numbers
Provides specific line numbers and refactoring recommendations
Evaluates pattern implementation quality and suggests improvements
limitations: Analyzes only code shared in conversation, not entire codebases
Does not execute or modify any code
Cannot detect patterns across multiple files without context

use_cases.title: Review Code Quality
use_cases.description: Analyze your code to identify architectural issues and receive specific refactoring suggestions.

use_cases.title: Assess Codebase Health
use_cases.description: Evaluate team code for anti-patterns and ensure adherence to architectural standards.

use_cases.title: Learn Pattern Recognition
use_cases.description: Understand why certain patterns are problematic and how to fix them with practical examples.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Code File
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @pattern-detector to analyze this code and identify all design patterns and anti-patterns present.

prompt_templates.title: Focus on Problems
prompt_templates.prompt: @pattern-detector --anti-patterns-only this code and explain each problem with severity level.

prompt_templates.title: Check Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @pattern-detector to check if this code follows proper pattern implementation practices.

prompt_templates.title: Get Recommendations
prompt_templates.prompt: @pattern-detector this code and provide specific recommendations for improving the architecture with code examples.

best_practices: Start with anti-pattern detection to identify the most critical issues first
Focus refactoring efforts on God Objects and Spaghetti Code before optimizing patterns
Use pattern recommendations as a guide, not a mandate - context matters
anti_patterns: Using pattern-detector to justify over-engineering instead of keeping solutions simple
Ignoring severity levels and trying to fix low-priority issues first
Applying patterns without understanding the specific problem they solve

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Pattern detection works for any language with standard OOP patterns including JavaScript, Python, Java, and C++.

faq.question: How deep does the analysis go?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes code structure and organization. It does not execute code or perform static analysis.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my IDE?
faq.answer: This is an AI skill that works within Claude, Codex, and Claude Code conversations.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only processes code you explicitly share in the conversation. No data is stored or transmitted.

faq.question: Why are some patterns marked questionable?
faq.answer: Patterns marked acceptable or questionable may be over-engineered or not ideal for the specific use case.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters check syntax and style. Pattern detection identifies architectural issues and design decisions at a higher level.
